actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.J.Res. 18 (Sen. Scott, of SC):
        A joint resolution disapproving the rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to "Overdraft Lending: Very Large Financial Institutions".

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Passed Senate without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 48. Record Vote Number: 153 



 S.Res. 148 (Sen. Barrasso):
        A resolution honoring the life of the Honorable Alan K. Simpson, former Senator for the State of Wyoming.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN13-9:
        Paul Lawrence, of Virginia, to be Deputy Secretary of Veterans Affairs

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 154 


        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 45. Record Vote Number: 155 



 PN25-56:
        Matthew Whitaker, of Iowa, to be United States Permanent Representative on the Council of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, with the rank and status of Ambassador

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate and vote 3/31/2025.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Cornyn, at  4:39 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until  3 p.m. on Monday, March 31, 2025.
